title: Circle Area Calculator
description: Calculate the area of a circle. Find the area by entering the radius or diameter of the circle.

inputs.name: radius
inputs.label: Radius
inputs.helpText: Enter the radius of the circle

formula: (function() { const area = Math.PI * radius * radius; const circumference = 2 * Math.PI * radius; return { area: area, circumference: circumference }; })()
howTo: Enter the radius of the circle
Click "Calculate" to compute the area and circumference
The result shows the area in square units and circumference in linear units

faq.question: What is the formula for circle area?
faq.answer: The area of a circle is calculated using the formula: Area = π × r², where r is the radius and π (pi) is approximately 3.14159.

faq.question: What if I only have the diameter?
faq.answer: If you have the diameter, divide it by 2 to get the radius, then use the area formula. Alternatively, you can use: Area = π × (diameter/2)².

faq.question: What is the value of π (pi)?
faq.answer: π (pi) is approximately 3.14159, but it's an irrational number with infinite decimal places. This calculator uses JavaScript's Math.PI which provides high precision.

faq.question: What units should I use?
faq.answer: You can use any unit of length (meters, feet, inches, etc.). The area will be in square units, and circumference will be in the same linear units as the radius.

faq.question: What's the relationship between area and circumference?
faq.answer: Circumference = 2 × π × radius, and Area = π × radius². The circumference is the perimeter (distance around) the circle, while area is the space inside it.
